messages.subject: Re: Intro/ surfing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/6/99 10:20:27 PM Eastern Standard Time, jhawthorne@home.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/6/99 10:20:27 PM Eastern Standard Time,
jhawthorne@... writes:

<< I can watch with a smile which if I sit far enough away
she can't tell is frozen. I work on my terror problem but it is a
challenge. >>

I am taking my two skiing just here in Ohio) starting in Jan. I don't
ski, 11yro skiid when he was 7 and did great but this year I won't have my
big boys with me who do ski so I will be also watching. terrified although I
will put on a brave face.
I'm not sure what scares me most, the skiing or the lift.LOL

laura

messages.subject: Re: Intro/ surfing
messages.msgSnippet: Psst, Joel, for a small fee I won t tell her that Cirques du Soliel is now on videos which can be had at your friendly neighborhood stores such as Costco
messages.messageBody:
Psst, Joel, for a small fee I won't tell her that Cirques du Soliel is now
on videos which can be had at your friendly neighborhood stores such as
Costco <g> Or that they have schools in Canada and Florida for kidlets <g>

Now, then you would have to do more than paste on a smile!

Lynda

----------

> From: Joel Hawthorne <jhawthorne@...>
>
> A great problem to have. Passionate involvement in something you love is
a
> wonderful gift. I sadly would be scared half to death. My youngest
> daughter (almost 7) is in a group called Cirkids and she like trapezeey
> sorts of things. I can watch with a smile which if I sit far enough away
> she can't tell is frozen. I work on my terror problem but it is a
> challenge.

messages.subject: Re: Intro/ surfing
messages.msgSnippet: A great problem to have.  Passionate involvement in something you love is a wonderful gift.  I sadly would be scared half to death.  My youngest daughter
messages.messageBody:
A great problem to have. Passionate involvement in something you love is a
wonderful gift. I sadly would be scared half to death. My youngest
daughter (almost 7) is in a group called Cirkids and she like trapezeey
sorts of things. I can watch with a smile which if I sit far enough away
she can't tell is frozen. I work on my terror problem but it is a
challenge.

megates@... wrote:

> From: megates@...
>
> >>>I am still having trouble diving completely into unschooling as my
> youngest son is
> obsessive about his sport of choice (surfing). If I didn't give him a
> framework to work within, he would only come in for food and sleep. >>>>

best wishes
Joel

All children behave as well as they are treated. The Natural Child
